comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.12; rv:58.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/58.0
Build ID: 20171109100107

Steps to reproduce:

On macOS Sierra:

1. Select View -> Enter Full Screen


Actual results:

The window fullscreened but the toolbar and tab strip stayed visible.

This happens regardless of the browser.fullscreen.autohide setting.


Expected results:

The toolbar and tab strip should have disappeared.
comments.author: kevin@sb.org

comments.text: This behavior seems to be as expected. Can you clarify what you expect to happen here and why?
comments.author: spohl.mozilla.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text: browser.fullscreen.autohide is documented to "Automatically collapse toolbars and the tab strip in fullscreen mode and only show on mouseover." This does not happen. The toolbars and tab strip are always visible regardless of the value of this setting. I expect them to disappear when I fullscreen the window and only reappear when I mouse over the top of the screen, similar to how both Safari and Chrome behave when their "Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen" settings are turned off.
comments.author: kevin@sb.org

comments.text:
Thanks for clarifying. Has this worked before? In what version did this stop working?

If this has worked before it would be great to get a regression range using mozregression:
http://mozilla.github.io/mozregression/
comments.author: spohl.mozilla.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text: I haven't run Firefox on macOS in many many years, so I don't know if this has ever worked.
comments.author: kevin@sb.org

comments.text: Thanks. First step is to run mozregression and see if there is a regression range. I will not be able to get to this in the near future.
comments.author: spohl.mozilla.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text: Ok I ran mozregression, the first build it tried was 2009-01-01, and that also didn't hide its toolbars. So I'm guessing this has been broken ever since macOS Lion, when they changed how fullscreen behavior works.
comments.author: kevin@sb.org

comments.text: Thanks for reporting this bug. I recently started using a Mac (High Sierra - OS X 10.13.3), and this was the first problem I noticed with Firefox on the platform. I frequently use full-screen on Linux and Windows laptops due to limited screen size, so it was jarring that it didn't work properly on MacOS.
